name: Sidney Jones
title: Lead Software Engineer — AI
summary: Senior engineering leader focused on building production-grade AI platforms and services. Track record delivering scalable backend systems, LLM integration and orchestration, retrieval-augmented applications, and CI/CD-driven delivery on AWS. Experienced with Python, FastAPI, Postgres, Terraform, and observability to drive safe, performant ML-enabled features into production.

technical_proficiencies.ai: LLMs (OpenAI/Anthropic), Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG), embeddings, vector search (OpenSearch/Elasticsearch), prompt engineering, model fine-tuning
technical_proficiencies.cloud: AWS (Lambda, ECS, EKS, S3, CloudWatch), Terraform, serverless, VPCs, IAM
technical_proficiencies.devops: GitHub Actions, Jenkins, CI/CD, Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform, observability (CloudWatch, Dynatrace)

experience.role: Senior Application Architect / Platform Team Delivery Lead

bullets.text: Led modernization of Online Access platform by decomposing monoliths into microservices and micro-frontends and introducing FastAPI/Java services to support RAG-enabled features.
Established CI/CD pipelines and release practices (feature flags, short-lived branches) across 13 teams using GitHub Actions and Jenkins to enable rapid, safe delivery of AI-enabled services.
Standardized observability and monitoring for AI inference and data pipelines using CloudWatch and Dynatrace, reducing mean-time-to-detect for regressions in production ML features.
Architected and deployed Terraform-based IaC modules and GitHub Actions workflows for API Gateway and Lambda microservices, enabling reproducible environments and zero-drift infrastructure.
Implemented automated IaC validation, security scanning, and rollback strategies to ensure safe deployments of data-processing and model-serving stacks.
Designed and deployed production ML orchestration and automation pipelines that integrated LLMs into business workflows, using Python, AWS Lambda, and serverless components for scalable inference.
Built ETL and data pipelines to generate embeddings and maintain searchable vector stores for RAG applications, integrating with OpenSearch and Postgres-based metadata layers.
Integrated LLMs into dev workflows to automate code generation and validation, and created guardrails for safe production usage (rate-limiting, token monitoring, prompt validation).
Built enterprise-grade QA automation and performance testing frameworks used to validate large-scale distributed systems and support continuous delivery efforts.
